Granville Island Public Market Review | Bon Appetit

At this sprawling indoor market on Granville Island, located centrally on False Creek, you’ll need to plan your visit accordingly to avoid the crowds, but there are a lot of compelling things to eat. Come hungry.ORDER THE: Montreal-style bagels from Siegel’s; bison bresaola from Oyama meats; smokehouse cheddar or bleu bénédictin from Benton Brothers Fine Cheese; lobster and fish cakes from L’Epicerie Rotisserie and Gourmet Shop; smoked candied salmon or sablefish from Longliner Seafoods; spot prawns off the dock, if in season; the giant fritter (if you’re feeling brave) from Lee’s Donuts; and a small jar of birch syrup from the Edible Canada shop just opposite the market.THE VIBE IS: busy and eclectic, with tourists and locals alike. Once you’ve purchased your bounty, head outside and set up a picnic next to False Creek.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day, from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.—Lindsay AndersonGrant HarderGrant HarderGrant HarderWE ALSO LOVEBeta5A Mount Pleasant sweets shop pushing cacao boundaries since 2011St. LawrenceTake a “trip” to Quebec via Vancouver’s Downtown EastsideRodney’s Oyster HouseSerious oyster curation in Yaletown, but that’s about where the seriousness endsExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
